data.title: A good place for pho
data.text: It's a clean place at a filthy, seedy location. In you crave for pho, in Rancho and Folsom area, but do not want to drive all the way to Stockton Blvd, this is a good choice.  They serve one of the best pho in town, minus MSG.  Unfortunately, their business has always been poor, possibly due to the location.

data.title: Partly sunny...great crispy pork rolls
data.text:
i think this place is pretty good if you can ignore the seedy neighborhood and atmosphere. You can sit down to eat, but for me this is take out only. I mean it wasn't bad, just pretty run down. I also know this can mean a mom and pop place with great food, so I looked past all of that to focus on the food...

I decided to try the Bun which is cold vermicelli noodles with veggies, grilled meat and fish sauce. So, I ordered the grilled pork with crispy shrimp and pork rolls. The grilled pork was tender, moist and nicely seasoned. The crispy shrimp and pork rolls were quite good, some of the best I've had. The veggies seemed more like a restaurant side salad than Chinese veggies, so that fell a bit flat for me. The fish sauce and vermicelli noodles were good and the meal was very reasonably priced at $8.25.

So if you're looking for atmosphere, this is not the place. But if you are looking for some decent carry out at a reasonable price, then this is worth a try. And get the crispy pork rolls because they are a winner.
